intro: Galeobdolon tuberiferum, commonly known as the tuberous galeobdolon, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant produces underground tubers, which are its primary storage organs and contribute to its survival in arid conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Galeobdolon tuberiferum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to full sun exposure.
